author: Katie Amey for MailOnline
title: Expedia reveals their best-reviewed hotels of the year
text:
179 shares 9
View
comments
Holidaymakers looking for something truly special would do well to check out these premier hotel destinations.
These top-ranked properties have impressed some of the most discerning critics, earning the honour of best-reviewed hotels on Expedia's annual crowd-sourced list.
And they're far more diverse than you might have imagined - from an old-world apartment-style hotel in Dubrovnik to a five-star luxury resort and spa in Thailand.
But they do all have a few things in common: exceptional customer service, high-end amenities and a minimum guest review score of 4.6 out of five.
The Royal Palms Hotel is a boutique property in Bermuda made up of two pink, 19th century manor homes - and beloved by Expedia users

Royal Palms Hotel, Bermuda
Near Hamilton, this beloved boutique hotel is made up of two pink, 19th century manor homes, and nestled in lush, colourful gardens
The property boasts 32 rooms, each decorated in classic Colonial and Bermudian style, complete with white shutters and a vast wraparound porch.

And Expedia reviewers are clearly just as charmed by the hotel's sophisticated elegance - it's been rated 4.9 out of five with 100 per cent of users recommending the 'exceptional' property.
Calenga Apartments, Dubrovnik, Croatia
The Calenga Apartments, which are located in Dubrovnik's Old Town, exude elegant sophistication in a romantic atmosphere
The cobblestone streets may make the property difficult to find, but the apartments are just a five minute walk to many attractions
These private apartments in Dubrovnik's Old Town exude old-world romance.
The building is conveniently located steps away from the House of Marin Drzic, Franciscan Monastery, and Onofrio's Fountain and just a five minute walk to the Church of St. Blaise and Orlando's Column.
Guests can rent one of six apartments, all of which boast deep soaking tubs and are recommended by 100 per cent of those who have stayed there. Weekly housekeeping is also available.
Pumilio Mountain & Ocean Hotel, Costa Rica
This family-friendly hotel is close to the Rainforest Adventures theme park and has two outdoor pools for children to enjoy
This family-friendly hotel, located in Jaco, Costa Rica, is the perfect place to take the kids.
Not only is it just five kilometres away from the Rainforest Adventures theme park, but the property itself offers two outdoor pools for children to splash around in and a free buffet breakfast to fuel them for a day of trekking.
And for parents looking to sneak in some 'me time,' there's also a full-service spa on site.
No wonder 96 per cent of guests recommend the 'superb' rustic paradise.
Woolleys Classic Suites, Denver, Colorado
Woolleys Classic Suites is a sprawling city hotel that provides business and leisure travellers with an anything-but-basic experience
The sprawling hotel has 190 rooms, an indoor pool, 24-hour fitness centre and a large atrium restaurant (pictured)
A far cry from the Costa Rican rain forest, this big city escape is perfect for business or leisure travellers alike.
The sprawling hotel, which boasts 190 rooms, has both an indoor poor, atrium restaurant and 24-hour fitness centre.
It's conveniently located in Denver's business district and is also close to University of Colorado and the city's History Museum.
Though many visitors had never heard of this hotel until they stayed, all reviewers were pleasantly surprised by the anything-but-basic business hotel, rating it an impressive 4.9 out of five.
Dormy Inn Sapporo Annex, Japan
Ranked as 'fabulous' by Expedia reviewers, the Dormy Inn Sapporo Annex in Japan has a sauna and steam room on site
This 'fabulous' three-and-a-half star hotel is just a 15-minute walk to Sapporo's Odori Park and Clock Tower.
The all-wood exterior houses a restaurant, sauna, steam room and 156 guest rooms.
Visitors note that while the rooms are small, the value for money is undeniable - and a staggering 99 per cent of reviewers would recommend the property to their friends.
B+B Edinburgh, Scotland
B+B Edinburgh in Scotland is a family-friendly guesthouse has an impressive 4.6 out of five rating among Expedia reviewers
Located in the heart of charming Edinburgh, this family-friendly guesthouse is just a 10 to 15 minute walk to some of the city's top attractions.
All of the property's 27 rooms are outfitted in sleek decor, complete with all modern conveniences, and the hotel's downstairs lounge - with its floor to ceiling book cases - will charm any bookworm.
Guest reviewers adore the quirky interiors, shortbread lounge and full Scottish breakfast, rating the accommodation 4.6 out of five.
Hotel Panorama, Sardinia, Italy
Hotel Panorama in Sardinia, Italy, is recommended by 100% of those who have stayed there. Not surprising considering the views
The hotel's rooftop terrace overlooks the city's port, making this four-star property an ideal location for a romantic getaway
The 'exceptional' property, which 100 per cent of users recommend, is classed as a four-star romantic destination, just steps to the National Archaeological Museum of Olbia.
It's also quite near the Church of San Paolo, Basilica of San Simplicio and the city's waterfront.
Aside from its stellar location, reviewers also applaud its friendly staff, full-service spa and health club, and on-site sauna.
Santhiya Koh Phangan Resort & Spa, Thailand
Santhiya Koh Phangan Resort & Spa in Thailand is a five-star beachfront property that spreads out across 18 acres
With an outdoor swimming pool, private beach, spa and health club, there's no reason that any of the guests would ever want to leave
The five-star resort and spa, situated on the picturesque Thong Nai Pan Noi Bay, is the ultimate beachfront hideaway.
A sprawling resort, spread over 18 acres of lush tropical landscapes, Santhiya offers an extensive outdoor swimming pool, private beach, health club, and indoor and outdoor dining options.
Plus, the on-site spa is a full-service masterpiece, offering massages, body treatments and facials.
Expedia reviewers love the 'exceptional' resort's amazing service and idyllic setting.
Hotel Orion Motobu Resort & Spa, Japan
All of the 238 rooms at the Hotel Orion Motobu Resort & Spa on the island of Okinawa in Japan have balconies overlooking the ocean

Japan's second entry on this top ten list is a beachfront resort on the island of Okinawa.
The family-friendly spot is just a 15-minute walk of the famed Emerald Beach, as well as the aquarium - though you may never want to leave the hotel property itself.
Not only are there four restaurants and indoor and outdoor pool and plenty of bar options, all of the 238 rooms also boast balconies, offering stunning ocean views as far as the eye can see.
One hundred per cent of guests would recommend the hotel, which they've also given 4.7 out of five stars.
Best Western Premier Weinebrugge, Bruges, Belgium
This family-friendly hotel is located close enough to Bruges to explore the city centre, yet far enough away to ensure quiet nights in
This family-friendly hotel is located close to the local sea park in Sint-Michiels, near Bruges - and is perfect for those travelling with small children.
It's convenient location is just a quick drive into the city centre, while still far enough away to ensure a quiet night in with the kids.
'The simple fact is, every traveler is looking for value out of their hotel experience,' said John Morrey, Vice President and General Manager, Expedia.com.
'Value can be defined in many ways by different people. But when you aggregate that feedback, you come away with a list of hotels that simply do it right, day in and day out.
'For Expedia, when we share a summary of real reviews penned by real hotel customers, we are giving travelers the data they need to make booking decisions.'
